statement.tex: %text The binary operation $*:\mathbf{R}\times\mathbf{R}\rightarrow\mathbf{R}$ is defined as $a*b=2a+b$. Find $(2*3)*4$. %

step.reason: %text The binary operator * is used twice. Each instance needs to be treated independently. % \begin{align} R_1=2*3 &= (2\times 2)+3 \\ R_2=R_1*4 &= (2\times R_1)+4 \\ &= (2\times((2\times 2)+3))+4 \\ &= (2\times 7)+4=18 \end{align}

step.context: %text Can you demonstrate using $(2*3)*4$ that the binary operator $*$ is associative? %
step.reason: %text Binary operator $*$ is{\bf not} associative, as is clearly evidenced by the calculation below. % \begin{align} (2*3)*4&=2\times(2\times 2+3)+4 \\ &=2\times 7+4=18 \\ 2*(3*4) &=2\times 2+(2\times 3+4) \\ &=2\times 2+10=14 \end{align}
